channel.title: mac on Joost Plattel
channel.description: Recent content in mac on Joost Plattel

item.title: Writing SwiftUI apps With Chat-GPT
item.description: ChatGPT is all the rage nowadays. Personally I’ve used it quite a few times and professionally as a software developer it’s interesting to use. I don’t fear for my job/knowledge (yet!) as it’s mostly integrations and not of the shelf code… (I haven’t tried the hardware space in Chat GPT yet….. paperclips might be optimized..) ✌️ To figure out how useful it might be for me, I embarked on a journey together with ChatGPT to build a piece of software that would solve issues that I’d had with the Mac OS X Finder for a while.

item.title: Finder Favorites
item.description: A simple app that let’s you group column views of favorite folders

item.title: My daily journaling scripts for Obsidian
item.description: Since I’m quite a heavy user of Obsidian I’d like to share some of my scripts I’ve written for it. Please note that all of the scripts make use of Keyboard Meastro as a way to activate them and some of them use javascript automation within Mac OS X. So it’s Apple only for now. Within Obsidian I’m keeping a folder in which there are files that are used as a templates.
